skill.name: security-headers
skill.description: Validate and implement HTTP security headers to protect web applications.
skill.summary: Validate and implement HTTP security headers to protect web applications.
skill.author: CuriousLearner

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with no executable code. Contains only instructional content for analyzing and implementing HTTP security headers. No file access, network calls, or code execution capabilities.

content.user_title: Analyze and implement HTTP security headers
content.value_statement: Web applications often ship without critical security headers, leaving them vulnerable to XSS, clickjacking, and data theft. This skill provides expert guidance on analyzing existing header configurations and implementing comprehensive security headers tailored to your stack.
actual_capabilities: Analyze HTTP response headers for security posture
Identify missing or misconfigured security headers
Generate comprehensive security header reports with remediation guidance
Provide implementation code for Express.js, Nginx, and Apache
Review CORS settings for security compliance
limitations: Does not perform live scans of websites or APIs
Provides guidance only; requires user to implement recommendations
Relies on user-provided header information for analysis

use_cases.title: Implement security headers
use_cases.description: Add CSP, HSTS, and X-Frame-Options headers to protect web applications from common attacks.

use_cases.title: Configure server headers
use_cases.description: Set up security headers in Nginx, Apache, or Express.js configurations with production-ready code snippets.

use_cases.title: Audit header configurations
use_cases.description: Review HTTP headers against OWASP recommendations and compliance standards like PCI-DSS.

prompt_templates.title: Analyze headers
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze the following HTTP response headers for security issues and provide recommendations: [paste headers here]

prompt_templates.title: Generate CSP
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a Content-Security-Policy header for a web application that loads scripts from self and a trusted CDN, styles from self with inline allowed, images from self and data URIs, and connects to a specific API endpoint.

prompt_templates.title: Fix CORS issues
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this CORS configuration for security issues and suggest improvements: [paste CORS code here]

prompt_templates.title: HSTS implementation
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how to implement Strict-Transport-Security header for [Express.js/Nginx/Apache] with preload and includeSubDomains directives.

output_examples.input: Analyze these headers: X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff, X-Frame-Options: DENY
output: Missing Critical Headers: Content-Security-Policy, Strict-Transport-Security, Permissions-Policy
Security Grade: C (50/100) - Basic protection present but missing key defenses
Immediate Actions: Add CSP to prevent XSS attacks, enable HSTS to enforce HTTPS

best_practices: Start CSP in report-only mode to identify violations before enforcing
Use nonce-based or hash-based script allowances instead of unsafe-inline
Implement HSTS with includeSubDomains only after verifying HTTPS works on all subdomains
anti_patterns: Using wildcard CORS origins with credentials enabled
Deploying CSP without testing in report-only mode first
Keeping deprecated headers like X-XSS-Protection instead of using CSP

faq.question: Does this skill scan my website?
faq.answer: No. This skill provides guidance and code examples. You must manually share your headers or run your own scans.

faq.question: Which servers are supported?
faq.answer: Configuration examples are provided for Express.js, Nginx, Apache, and generic HTTP servers.

faq.question: Does it check compliance standards?
faq.answer: Yes. References OWASP recommendations, PCI-DSS, and HIPAA security header requirements.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a prompt-based skill with no network access or code execution capabilities.

faq.question: Why are my CSP violations happening?
faq.answer: Common causes include inline scripts, third-party resources not in allowlist, and dynamic script generation.

faq.question: Does this work with CDNs?
faq.answer: Yes. Headers can be configured at CDN level (Cloudflare, AWS CloudFront, Fastly) using the provided examples.
